name: Gorebyss
text: His body is durable enough to withstand high-pressure levels in the deep sea. Do not confuse with HBase, Couchbase, MeshBase, Graphbase or KirbyBase.

name: Tokutek
text: Tokutek claims to improve MongoDB performance 20x. It is unclear if this also means losing 20x as many documents.

name: Adabas
text: ADABAS was NoSQL from a time when there was no SQL. The technology now is owned by Software AG. "Software AG: We're not sure what we do either."

name: Feebas
text: Feebas requires Swift Swim to get marvel scale.

name: Azurill
text: Azurill's tail is large and bouncy. Azurill can be seen bouncing and playing on its big, rubbery tail. On sunny days they gather at the edge of water and splash about for fun.

name: Hadoop
text: Hadoop is a distributed system for counting words.

name: Vulpix
text: Munchlax is a great counter to Vulpix, being able to take four Fire Blasts from the Life Orb set and hit back hard with Earthquake or STAB Return.

name: Hekaton
text: Refer to lock-free architecture for SQL Server 2014. Not to be confused with Magneton, the levitating Pokémon.

name: Delibird
text: The 25th of December is his favorite day.

name: Summingbird
text: This Twitter technology combines streaming, MapReduce, Scalding, Scala and Storm. Potential users must prove they are a hipster before they are allowed to download.

name: Akiban
text: Touted as SQL database with object structured storage, Akiban was recently acquired by another database vendor you have never heard of.

name: Arbok
text: Despite reports to the contrary, Arbok does not evolve into Seviper.

name: Flink
text: Apache Flink will help us with batch and stream processing, but the logo is cute enough to become Pokémon.

name: Impala
text: Querying big data is too slow? Impala has a solution for it. But reconsider taming that one, it is built on C++.

name: Pangool
text: It's like Sandlash, but it will help us to develop map reduce jobs for Hadoop.

name: Azkaban
text: It's not the evolution from Abra, Kadabra, or Alakazam, nor related with Harry Potter. Azkaban is workflow scheduler, just like crontab, but with graphical interface.

name: Arvados
text: Not to be confused with Ariados. Spins a web of microservices around unsuspecting sysadmins.

name: Seahorse
text: Not to be confused with Horsea. Seahorse lets you create Apache Spark applications in a visual way.

name: Horsea
text: Horsea is a small, blue, seahorse-like Pokémon with a single dorsal fin and a tightly curled tail.

name: Titan
text: Titan is a distributed graph database that is unfortunately not related to the legendary titans, a term coined by Pokémon the Movie 2000 - The Power of One, referring to Articuno, Zapdos, and Moltres.

name: Atlassian
text: Atlassian has somehow duped several software companies into thinking they need JIRA to be agile; if only we all had the agility move in real life.

name: Jirachi
text: Jirachi is a steel and psychic-type Pokémon with no known evolutions. It should not be confused with JIRA, an issue tracker for software teams.

name: Spoink
text: Spoink is a bouncy psychic-type Pokémon that should not be confused with Splunk, a software suite for analyzing log data.

name: Debezium
text: Debezium is a tool for turning your coherent relational data into indecipherable big data. Not to be confused with Meganium the herb Pokémon

name: Geode
text: Geode is a database like model, which makes people to ask more why Hadoop is not RDBMS. Not be be confused with Geodude which rocks

name: Geodude
text: Geodude is a hard rock pokemon immune to one hit ko, not like my Hadoop cluster. Unlike Geode which make you more confuse about big data.

name: Ambari
text: Ambari is a tool that makes administration of Hadoop easy so you can make fun of the developers when they run out of executors. Not to be confused with Ambipom which is a long tail pokemon.
